We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.\n\nWe are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.\nRole Summary\n\nMagna Global IT is seeking a talented and experienced HR Data Conversion Analyst. Main responsibility of the role will be to lead the end-to-end data conversion process from current legacy systems into Workday for Magna divisions globally. As an ideal candidate you thrive in an... entrepreneurial and highly dynamic environment and you are excited by the opportunity to analyze large and/or complex data sets. You ask questions to ensure you understand requirements and are a quick thinker. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done and can visualize the results and present them to our top management.\n\nThere is the possibility to also exercise these activities in our office in Belgrade (Serbia), by arrangement and subject to availability of internal resources.\nKey Responsibilities\n• Data Conversion: Coordinate tasks and activities for extraction, transformation, analysis, and load of data from legacy systems into Workday during multiple data gathering cycles.\n• Support Magna’s implementation partner with providing data for multiple tenants builds throughout the Workday implementation.\n• Define, validate, and coordinate the development of data quality checks in the data conversion hub using the inhouse built data quality engine.\n• Analyze data submitted by Magna Divisions and plan corrective actions, if applicable using SQL, Excel and PowerBI or other similar software\n• Analyze and review the data transformation logic based on the configuration workbooks provided by the functional teams\n• Log and manage the resolution of defects/issues\n• Work with Group Data Leads to fix data defects and continually improve the data transformation logic\n• Measure and track progress, and provide weekly status updates to the stakeholders\n• Managing data quality related topics in terms of data cleansing and general data quality improvement, working to the Group Data Leads as required\n• Effectively communicate insights, recommendations, and its impact to both technical and non-technical teams and business partners\nKey Qualifications/Requirements\n• Ability to sift through data, identify critical information, analyze, and make recommendations to broader audience required\n• Ability to collaborate with both technical and business staff\n• Proven analytical and problem-solving skills\n• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English language, including ability to develop and deliver presentations. Additional Language skills are an advantage\n• SQL Knowledge – Microsoft SQL Server is an advantage\n• Expertise in development and analytical tools such as SSAS, SQL, MS Excel, or other tools, as well as visualization tools like PowerBI, SSRS, Workday Reporting (Report Writer)\n• Experience with Workday or similar HRIS is preferable\n• Responsive to changing business needs, manage and prioritize concurrent assignments, and handle ambiguity with ease.\n• Strong customer orientation and a consistent record of hitting deadlines.\n• Good project or program management skills to support data conversion and project-driven activities that require coordination of the stakeholders on either technical or functional side.\n• Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information.\n• Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management an advantage\nKnowledge and Education\n• Advanced degree, applicable certification, or equivalent experience in Operations Research, Management Science, Industrial and Systems Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field\nWork Experience\n• 3+ years of practical experience with data analytics, business analysis or data conversion,\n• 2+ years in a data conversion role with experience in Human Resources, preferably with Workday HCM\nAdditional Information\n• Office environment\n• 5-15% Regular Travel\n• Strong English skills are mandatory\n\nFor dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.\n\nThis posiiton is limited to a 14-months contract. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.\n\nJob Description\n\nAre you looking for a patient-focused, innovative-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as our Data Scientist in our office in Vienna, Austria.\n\nHere, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.\n\nAs our successful Data Scientist, you will collaborate with business users in different functions including Marketing, Operations and Supply Chain/Manufacturing to understand the current state and identify opportunities to transform the business into a data-driven organization.\n\nYou will translate processes, and requirements into analytics solutions and metrics with effective data... strategy, data quality, and data accessibility for decision making. Operationalize decision support solutions and drive use adoption as well as gathering feedback and metrics on Voice of Customer to improve analytics services.\n\nYou will understand and apply the appropriate quantitative techniques to provide businesses with actionable insights and ensure analytics model and data are access to the end users to evaluate “what-if” scenarios and decision making.\n\nYou will evaluate the data, analytical models, and experiments periodically to validate hypothesis ensuring it continues to provide business value as requirements and objectives evolve.\n\nYour New Opportunity:\n• Collaborate with business partners in identifying analytical opportunities and developing BI-related goals and projects that will create strategically relevant insights.\n• Work with internal and external partners to develop analytics vision and programs to advance BI solutions and practices.\n• Understand data and sources of data. Strategize with IT development team and develop a process to collect, ingest, and deliver data along with proper data models for analytical needs.\n• Interact with business users to define pain points, problem statement, scope, and analytics business case. Develop solutions with recommended data model and business intelligence technologies including data warehouse, data marts, OLAP modelling, dashboards/reporting, and data queries.\n• Work with DevOp and database teams to ensure proper design of system databases and appropriate integration with other enterprise applications.\n• Collaborate with Enterprise Data and Analytics Team to design data model and visualization solutions that synthesize complex data for data mining and discovery.\n• Assist in defining requirements and facilitates workshops and prototyping sessions.\n• Develop and applies technologies such as machine-learning, deep-learning algorithm to enable advanced analytics product functionality.\n\nYour Skills and Qualifications:\n• Bachelors’ Degree, from an accredited institution in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.\n• 3 - 5 years of experience in BI application development, and experience with data warehousing and reporting tools.\n• Experience and proficiency with BI and Analytics tools Qlik, Power BI, ETL, NoSQL/Graph databases, and Hadoop Platform with sharp analytical abilities and proven design skills.\n• A deep familiarity with analytical solutions including BI/Reporting and Dashboards.\n• Experience with statistical modelling such as clustering, segmentation, multivariate, regression, etc. and analytics tools such as R, Python, Databricks, SageMaker, etc. a plus.\n• Experience in developing and applying predictive and prescriptive modelling, deep-learning, or other machine learning techniques a plus.\n• Well-developed organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.\n• Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to interact effectively with multifunctional teams. Demonstrated aptitude for collaboration with other strategic partners.\n• Solid understanding of current and emerging BI/Advanced Analytics technologies. Expertise in the areas of Data, Data Modelling; Statistical Methods, and AI/ML preferred.\n• Familiarity with Analytics processes and service models.\n\nAt Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Takeda encourages and supports its employees by trainings, job rotations and mentoring. A balanced work – life ratio (recognition for work and family, company kindergarten) and numerous benefits (fitness center, cafeteria, etc.) complete our profile as a top employer.\n\nWe foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world. Gender, age, skin color, background or sexual orientation play no role in this as we actively promote diversity. We equally address people with disabilities. With its core brands, Zumtobel, Thorn and Tridonic, the Group offers its customers around the world a comprehensive portfolio of products and services.\n\nYour job\n\nIn this exciting position, you will be responsible for applying and developing statistical methods to solve specific business problems.\n• You analyze complex data and evaluate them using analysis models and algorithms.\n• You will also develop new data sources, test model improvements, and ensure improvement of existing methods by tuning model parameters.\n• You are actively involved in the creation and development of concepts for automated reporting and forecasting systems.\n• You will recognize and identify data patterns and gain meaningful and actionable insights through analysis.\n• This is how you support forward-looking business decisions and optimize existing... processes.\n• You understand business processes and are able to back them up with data and create derivations from the data.\n• With your outstanding analytical flair and understanding, you are able to define metrics and analytics models to build an enterprise-wide analytics system.\n\nYour profile\n\nYou are a digital native with a strong affinity for numbers, data and facts. In addition, they are characterized by their eagerness and willingness to structure data and to read and interpret it at different levels.\n• You have a degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration with a focus on data analysis or a similar specialization.\n• You have already been able to get a taste of professional life in a relevant work environment.\n• Personally, you convince with your independent and proactive working style. You have a strong analytical mindset and dare to make recommendations and suggestions for improvement.\n• You are driven by innovation, recognize the potential of important business processes and drive them forward on your own initiative and independently.\n• You like to think outside the box and are open to new processes, ideas and analytical methods.\n• You use your communication skills in English to your advantage when communicating with international colleagues and external stakeholders. German language skills are an advantage.\n• Sound knowledge of SAP as well as cloud computing solutions (AWS, GCP and IBM) round off your profile.\n\nLegally binding notice:\n\nBased on the minimum salary stipulated in the collective agreement of € 47.573,96 p.a. We offer fully-funded PhD positions in Biology, Neuroscience, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, Data science and Scientific Computing, in a world-class research environment on the outskirts of Vienna.\nStudents spend the first year completing coursework and rotations before choosing a thesis group. Our PhD graduates have gone on to top positions in academia and industry all over the world.\nIn 2019, IST Austria was ranked #3 in the world-wide Nature Index ranking (normalized). In 2018, IST Austria was ranked within the top ten of Nature Index Rising Stars “Top 30 academic institutions under 30” list and was featured in this article in Nature Index. The Institute also has, with 48%, the highest ERC Grant success rate compared to other European institutions.\nJoin us for the Virtual Student... Open Day on November 26! More information and registration on our website.\nThe application deadline is January 8, 2022 (11:59 PM CET), for a Ph.D. start date in September 2022.\nApply\nPhD Program\nThe goal of the PhD program at the Institute of Science and Technology Austria (IST Austria) is to produce intellectually broad, curious, open-minded scientists who are able to approach problems from different angles and can collaborate with diverse types of scientists. To this end, our students complete an innovative interdisciplinary training program consisting of both research and taught elements, and receive close mentoring by world-class faculty from different disciplines. All students whose broad research interests align with those of our faculty are eligible to join the IST Austria PhD program. Selection of the thesis supervisor occurs at the end of the first year.\nIn the first year, students complete coursework and rotations in three different research groups. After selecting a thesis supervisor and passing the qualifying examination, students work on their thesis research, attend international conferences and colloquia, and receive training in teaching and other transferable skills. Research groups are deliberately kept small to ensure close supervision, and all students are mentored by several faculty members who make up their thesis committee.\nAll students are offered 5-year contracts. All students making reasonable progress are fully funded until the time of their thesis defense.\nFinancial support\nAll our PhD students are fully funded, at internationally competitive salary levels, and receive full social security coverage. There is also financial support for students for attending scientific conferences and workshops.\nInternational and Diverse Scientific Community\nOur scientists, from professors to postdocs to students, hail from all corners of the world, representing over 70 different nationalities, and building on research and degrees earned from the finest global scientific institutes and universities.\nEnglish-Speaking\nWe use English throughout the institute as the language of instruction and communication.\nInterdisciplinary\nOur Graduate Program is characterized by modern comprehensive training with a special focus on interdisciplinarity.\nCutting-edge Research Training\nStudents work closely with outstanding faculty within small research groups and have access to first-rate facilities. Students spend the first year completing coursework and rotations before affiliating with a group.\nThis first phase of exploration allows students to be sure that the research topic, as well as the research group, are the best match for them before they embark on in-depth thesis research in the second phase.\nEntry with a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree\nWe welcome students with a bachelor’s or a master’s in science to apply to our PhD program', 'thumbnail': 'https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTHeclDKRjw2CBBeySkcFc0rEAkXV_yik4LsKil&s=0', 'extensions': ['Vor über 1\xa0Monat', 'Vollzeit'], 'detected_extensions': {'posted_at': 'Vor über 1\xa0Monat', 'schedule_type': 'Vollzeit'}, 'job_id': ''}{'title': 'Solution Architect, Data Integration Focus', 'company_name': 'Qlik', 'location': 'Österreich (+\xa01 weiterer Standort)', 'via': 'über Jobvite', 'description': 'What makes us Qlik\n\nQlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. Change Data Capture (CDC), DWH Automation, Data Lake creation and Data Cataloging with Qlik Application Automation for automated workflow integration with many 3rd party systems\n• Qlik Data Analytics (QDA)– self-service analytics and visualizations driven by Qlik’s unique Associative Engine, augmented by AI-powered insight generation, conversational analytics, machine Learning, purely browser-based and fully embeddable\n• Qlik Data Literacy-as-a-Service (DLaaS)– Qlik’s global initiative to increase data literacy and data competencies for all members of an organization\n\nOur customers are free to choose any of the above components individually or all products in combination which we call the Qlik Active Intelligence Platform. It is available as full SaaS offer, true hybrid, or customer-managed deployment.\n\nJob Category\n\nPre-Sales\n\nSolution Architect, Data Integration Focus\n\nSounds interesting so far? In this responsible role, you will have the unique opportunity to be part of a multidisciplinary competence center for pediatric oncology and to have a direct influence on the development of new cancer therapies.\n\nThe Taschner-Mandl group tackles unresolved questions of neuroblastoma pathogenesis and develops new diagnostic and therapeutic approaches to facilitate precision medicine for children with malignant tumors. We study determinants of inter- and intra-tumor heterogeneity and metastasis in neuroblastoma by combining molecular biology and computer-based research (e.g. Weiss T et al., Nat Comm 2021, Kromp F et al., IEEE Trans Med Imaging, 2021, Kromp F et al., Nature Sci Data 2020). This project, will use... multimodal imaging at subcellular resolution and apply state-of-the-art methods including machine/deep-learning-based approaches for image analysis (segmentation, registration), cell classification and integration with single cell RNA-sequencing data.\n\nAs a PhD stuent, you will\n\nJoin an exciting, multi-disciplinary environment with lots of support for your personal and professional development from your supervisor, team, and peers\nBe part of an interdisciplinary research project on unraveling determinants of cancer metastasis in childhood cancer using automated immunofluorescence microscopy and imaging mass cytometry\nLearn to take on ambitious research in close collaboration with experimental and clinical researchers\nYou will contribute from the start including planning of experiments and data acquisition\nYou will provide thorough and creative thinking that makes these projects a success\nMonitor the literature and community resources to keep abreast latest developments and to identify information, data, and methods to integrate in your own work\nWrite papers, present your research at conferences, apply for fellowships, and contribute to grants\n\nYour profile\n\nMaster’s degree in a relevant subject (data science, biomedical engineering, medical informatics, visual computing, data science or similar)\nExcellent technical and attitude\n\nOur offer\n\nA meaningful, inspiring, and international environment\nAn outstanding working atmosphere in a strong team with excellent research and development opportunities\nAccess to state-of-the-art infrastructure\nFlexible working hours, discounted lunch in our canteen and other great benefits\nGreat location in the center of Vienna, a capital of biomedical research in Europe Anna Children’s Cancer Research Institute (CCRI), located in the center of Vienna, the world’s most livable city and one of Europe’s most important places for biomedical research and life sciences, is an international and multidisciplinary competence center striving to improve treatment of children and adolescents with cancer by connecting translational and clinical research with open-minded exploration of basic disease mechanisms. Through close cooperation between clinic and research, the CCRI provides an ideal environment for cutting-edge research and its translation into clinical practice. To achieve our ultimate goal of advancing the well-being of patients, the CCRI constantly pushes scientific boundaries and strongly promotes close collaboration and exchange with external institutions like the Medical University of Vienna, CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, the Institute of Molecular Biotechnology of the Austrian Academy of Sciences (IMBA) and the Institute of Molecular Pathology (IMP).\n\nThe CCRI is an equal opportunity employer. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.\n\nIn this role, you will advise customers and partners on how to do this best leveraging our ad solutions and privacy preserving technologies to take their marketing effectiveness and efficiency to the next level. You’ll be responsible for identifying opportunities and managing projects around privacy-centric... measurement with teams consisting of different roles on either client and Google’s side as well as finding ways to scale complex solutions across industries.\n\nOur Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age.
